Submodules¶

tweezer.io module¶

Input/Output routines for the tweezer package.

Performs file reads and data conversion.

tweezer.io.extract_meta_and_units(comment_list, file_type='man_data')[source]¶

Extracts metadata and units from the comments in raw tweezer data files

Parameters:
  • comment_list – (list) List of strings that hold the raw comment lines
  • file_type – (str) identifies the file type for which meta and units are extracted
Return CommentInfo:
 

(namedtuple) that holds dictionaries for metadata and units
tweezer.io.gather_tweebot_data(trial=1, subtrial=None)[source]¶
tweezer.io.read_distance_calibration_data(comments)[source]¶

Extract fit and l

Parameters:input – Description
tweezer.io.read_header(fileName)[source]¶
tweezer.io.read_tdms(fileName, frequency=1000)[source]¶

Reads data from Labview TDMS file.

Parameters:
  • fileName – (path) to tdms file
  • frequency – (int) sampling frequency in Hz (default is 1000 Hz, i.e. data taken at 1 ms time resolution)
Return data:

(pd.DataFrame) with the channels as columns and index based on fileName infos
tweezer.io.read_thermal_calibration(fileName, frequency=80000)[source]¶

Reads time series and calculated power spectra of a thermal calibration.

Parameters:
  • fileName – (path) to the tweezer time series file containing the raw values of the PSD signals
  • frequency – (int) sampling frequency of time series
Return ts:

(pandas.DataFrame) with the raw thermal calibration data. The index is time.
tweezer.io.read_tracking_data(fileName)[source]¶

Reads data from Tweezer Tracking files.

tweezer.io.read_tweebot_data(fileName)[source]¶

Reads dual-trap data and metadata from TweeBot datalog files.

Parameters:fileName – Path to the TweeBot datalog file.
Return data:(pandas.DataFrame) contains redorded data and also meta data and units as attributes.

Note

Test things like ‘data.units’ or data.meta to see what’s available. Be aware that pandas.DataFrames can mutate when certain actions and computations are performed (for example shape changes). It’s not clear whether the units and meta attributes persist.

Return calibration:
 Dictionary containing the metadata of the experiment
Return cal_units:
 Lookup Table for units of the calibration data

Usage

>>> data = read_tweebot_txt('27.Datalog.2013.02.17.19.42.09.datalog.txt')

Note

This function so far only works for TweeBot data files in the form of 2013

Warning

Currently this function removes duplicates in the timeSent column of the TweeBot datalog files.

tweezer.io.read_tweebot_data_header(datalog_file)[source]¶

Extracts the header of a Tweebot data log file as a list

:param datalog_file : (path) Tweebot datalog file from which the header is extracted

Return HeaderInfo:
 (namedtuple) info container with fields ‘column_names’, ‘metadata’, ‘units’, and ‘headerIndices’, ‘firstDataLine’

Usage:

>>> HeaderInfo = read_tweebot_data_header('27.Datalog.2013.02.17.19.42.09.datalog.txt')
tweezer.io.read_tweebot_logs(fileName)[source]¶

Reads data from TweeBot log files.

Parameters:fileName – (path) Tweebot log file to be parsed
Return log:(pd.DataFrame) with the logging data
tweezer.io.read_tweebot_stats(fileName)[source]¶

Reads data from TweeBot statistic files.

tweezer.io.read_tweezer_image_info(fileName, file_type='man_pics')[source]¶

Extracts basic information about an image

Parameters:fileName – (path) to the image
Return name:Description
tweezer.io.read_tweezer_power_spectrum(fileName)[source]¶

Reads data from tweezer power spectrum file. These files are produced by LabView and contain the raw PSDs and the fits used to extract trap calibration results

Parameters:fileName – (path) file path to the tweezer power spectrum file
Return psd:(pandas.DataFrame) with all the raw and fitted data as well as the fit results
tweezer.io.read_tweezer_txt(fileName)[source]¶

Reads dual-trap data and metadata contained in text files

tweezer.io.standardized_name_of(variable)[source]¶

Maps various variable names onto a common pattern

Parameters:variable – (str) input variable
tweezer.io.standardized_unit_of(variable)[source]¶

Maps various variable names onto their unit

Parameters:variable – (str) input variable
